revision.text: Possibly: A Discourse concerning the Resurrection of Jesus Christ. In three parts. Wherein, I. The consequence of the doctrine are stated hypothetically. II. The nature and obligation of moral evidence are explain'd at large. III. The proofs of the fact of our Saviour's resurrection are propos'd, examin'd, and fairly demonstrated to be conclusive. Together with an appendix concerning the impossible production of thought from matter and motion: the nature of human souls, and of brutes: the nima Mundi, and the hypothesis of the Το Παν; as also, concerning Divine Providence, the origin of Evil, and the Universe in general. By Humphry Ditton, late Master of the New Mathematical School in Christ's Hospital. (London : Printed for J. Batley at the Dove in Pater-noster-Row; and T. Cox at the Lamb under the Royal Exchange, M.DCC.XXVII. [1727]) http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2409399~S1
